item.title: A Less Than Ideal Way To Do 2-factor
item.description: I have concerns with how Duo does phone two-factor authentication and think we can all learn from the way Google does it. The issue: If a user has their password compromised it’s easy to convince them to authenticate a 2-factor request without doing anything that would set off a red flag. This is due to the specific way Duo does phone call authentication. Attacker required information: User password Phone number The attack:
